decks.notes: This deck focuses on assembling a winning combination of cards using the Doomsday spell. It aims to quickly generate mana with cards like Lotus Petal, Dark Ritual, and Cabal Ritual to cast Doomsday and set up a powerful win condition. The deck includes various cantrips and card draw spells like Ponder, Brainstorm, and Ideas Unbound to find key pieces and sculpt the perfect hand. It also includes disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Force of Will to interact with the opponent's strategy. Once the cards are set up, the deck can win by using Thassa's Oracle or Lion's Eye Diamond.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with powerful creatures and then cheat them into play using cards like Exhume, Reanimate, and Animate Dead. The deck utilizes cards like Thoughtseize and Grief to disrupt the opponent's plans and facilitate the combo. It also includes a few control elements like Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier to further disrupt the opponent and stabilize the board. Overall, the deck aims to rapidly assemble a dominant board presence and overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures.

This deck is a 4/5 color control deck for the Legacy 1 vs 1 format. The main concept revolves around using counterspells like Force of Will and Force of Negation to control the game. The deck also utilizes cards like Swords to Plowshares and Terminus for removal, and Brainstorm, Ponder, and Misty Rainforest for card manipulation and deck thinning. Additionally, the deck aims to create card advantage and gain life through Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath. It also includes a mix of lands for color fixing and a few unique cards like Leyline Binding, Lórien Revealed, and Xander's Lounge.

This deck focuses on utilizing the combo strategy of reanimating powerful creatures from the graveyard. It uses cards like Entomb and Thoughtseize to put high-impact creatures, such as Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, into the graveyard. It then uses cards like Reanimate and Animate Dead to bring these creatures back onto the battlefield for a significant advantage. The deck also includes disruptive elements with cards like Dauthi Voidwalker and Grief to disrupt the opponent's strategy. It has additional support cards like Liliana of the Veil and Currency Converter to further enhance the deck's game plan.

The key concept of this deck is to maintain control over the game by utilizing a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card draw. The deck focuses on efficient mana usage and deck manipulation through cards like Ponder, Brainstorm, and Misty Rainforest. It also includes powerful creatures like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath for versatility and board presence. The deck's win condition is not explicitly stated in the decklist, but it likely involves gaining an advantage through card advantage and eventually overwhelming the opponent.

This deck focuses on controlling the game by utilizing a mix of countermagic, removal spells, and card advantage. It aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while slowly accumulating resources and maintaining card advantage. The inclusion of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion allows for extra value and consistency in longer games. The deck also features cards like Terminus and Dress Down to reset the board and deal with threats, while Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath provides additional card draw and life gain. Overall, the deck aims to outlast and outvalue the opponent to secure victory.

The key concept of this deck is to aggressively control the game and disrupt the opponent's strategy while quickly dealing damage. It utilizes efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets and Dragon's Rage Channeler to apply pressure while countering spells with Force of Will and disrupting the opponent's mana base with Wasteland. The deck also has access to card draw and manipulation with Brainstorm and Ponder to ensure consistency. Murktide Regent provides a powerful finisher, and Unholy Heat and Lightning Bolt serve as versatile removal options. Overall, the deck aims to create a fast and disruptive tempo to overwhelm the opponent.

This Legacy Combo deck aims to quickly assemble the combo pieces needed for a game-winning play. The key concept is to use cards like Thought Lash and Paradigm Shift to exile the player's entire library, and then use Thassa's Oracle to win the game by having no cards left to draw. The deck includes numerous card draw spells like Preordain and Impulse to dig through the deck, as well as counterspells like Force of Will and Daze to protect the combo. The mana base consists of various lands that provide colored mana and acceleration, such as Otawara, Soaring City and Ancient Tomb.

This deck is a 4/5 color control deck focused on manipulating the opponent's board and hand while maintaining card advantage and control over the game. It uses cards like Ponder and Brainstorm to find and set up the desired combination of cards. The deck includes various dual lands and fetch lands to ensure proper mana fixing. It uses counterspells like Force of Will and Force of Negation to control the opponent's spells. In addition, it utilizes creature removal like Swords to Plowshares and board wipes like Terminus to maintain control. The deck also includes some unique cards like Mystic Sanctuary and Xander's Lounge to further boost its control abilities.

The key concept of this Aggro - Dragon Stompy deck is to disrupt the opponent's mana base and prevent them from casting spells effectively. This is achieved through cards like Blood Moon, Chalice of the Void, and Trinisphere. The deck also focuses on early aggression with cards like Goblin Rabblemaster and Fury to quickly deal damage to the opponent. The deck utilizes fast mana sources like Chrome Mox and Simian Spirit Guide to cast its spells faster. Additionally, it includes cards like Dead / Gone and Den of the Bugbear for further disruption and damage.

The key concept of this deck is to aggressively control the game through a combination of efficient spells and disruptive land destruction while applying pressure with versatile creatures. The deck aims to quickly control the board with Lightning Bolt and Wasteland, while using cantrips like Brainstorm and Ponder to find the right answers. Force of Will provides additional protection. The creature lineup consists of resilient threats like Murktide Regent and Dragon's Rage Channeler, supported by Lórien Revealed for card advantage and Orcish Bowmasters and Questing Druid for additional aggression and disruption.

The key concept of this deck is to quickly establish board control and disrupt the opponent's game plan using aggressive creatures and disruptive spells. The deck aims to play creatures with the ability to limit the opponent's resources, such as Archon of Emeria, while also having the option to remove threats with Solitude. The deck also utilizes fast mana acceleration cards like Chrome Mox and Lotus Petal to quickly deploy its threats and generate an advantage. Overall, the deck focuses on maintaining initiative and applying constant pressure to overpower the opponent.

The key concept of this Grixis Aggro deck is to maintain aggressive pressure on the opponent while disrupting their game plan. It achieves this by using low-cost creatures like Delver of Secrets, Dragon's Rage Channeler, and Orcish Bowmasters to quickly deal damage and control the board. The deck also includes spells like Lightning Bolt, Daze, and Force of Will to control the opponent's actions and protect its own creatures. Additionally, the deck utilizes card draw and manipulation with Ponder, Brainstorm, and Mishra's Bauble to maintain consistency and find the necessary pieces to win.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize a combination of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells to maintain control of the game. The deck focuses on countering opponent's spells with cards like Daze and Force of Will, while also having the ability to deal direct damage with Lightning Bolt. Delver of Secrets and Dragon's Rage Channeler provide a fast and threatening creature presence, with support from Murktide Regent for additional firepower. The deck also includes card selection and manipulation tools like Ponder, Brainstorm, and Misty Rainforest to ensure consistency and optimal plays.

This Legacy 1 vs 1 Control deck focuses on manipulating the opponent's deck and hand while protecting itself with counterspells. It uses cards like Ponder and Brainstorm to dig through the deck and find the right answers. It also includes removal spells like Swords to Plowshares to deal with threats. The deck has a variety of lands, allowing for flexibility in casting spells. The inclusion of Leyline Binding and Lórien Revealed suggests a theme of control and disruption. Additionally, the deck includes some unique cards like Xander's Lounge and Forth Eorlingas! that may offer additional advantages or surprises.

This Legacy 1 vs 1 Aggro - Artifacts Blue deck revolves around utilizing artifacts for quick and efficient aggression. The deck focuses on generating mana quickly with cards like Lotus Petal and Ancient Tomb, while also drawing cards with Thoughtcast and Mishra's Bauble. Chalice of the Void is used to disrupt opponents' strategies, and Pithing Needle can shut down specific cards or abilities. The deck also features key creatures such as Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Sai, Master Thopterist, which provide additional value and threats. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with its artifact-based aggression and disruption.
